page.title: 12Thomas More School
page.content: Our school building is 122 years old. The foundation stone was laid by Edward Prince of Wales in 1863. Originally it was an orphanage for 150 children. Today it is a catholic school. The 650 pupils dress in green and grey uni- forms. The school is a grade 2 listed building and a good example of Victorian Gothic architecture. It has a symmetrical design and a very elaborate main entrance in the centre of the building. Alot of smaller buildings have been added. There is now a swim- ming pool and a science block. This brickwork is patterned in red, white and black and the windows have stone columns and carved capitals. By Yvonne Pettican Thomas More School
